title: Creepy Cosmos! Scary space! Petrifying planets!
summary: An especially spooky Halloween edition of The Downlink.

title: Digital Community Manager (6-month temporary position)
summary: The Planetary Society, the world’s largest and most influential space advocacy organization, seeks a talented Digital Community Manager to join our communications team on a 6-month temporary contract beginning no later than November 28, 2022.

title: LOFTID: Demonstrating technology for large inflatable heat shields
summary: In the kickoff to the reusability roadmap for the United Launch Alliance (ULA) Vulcan Centaur rocket, the flight of an inflatable heat shield at a relevant scale will be demonstrated as a secondary payload on the next Atlas V rocket launch.

title: LOFTID: ULA former chief scientist instrumental in making mission a reality
summary: The re-entry experiment launching Nov. 1 aboard the Atlas V rocket pays tribute to a former United Launch Alliance (ULA) teammate who advocated for advancements in technology that would innovate launch vehicle reusability and could be used to land hu...

title: Planetary Radio has a new host
summary: After 20 years at the helm, our friend and colleague Mat Kaplan is retiring as the host of Planetary Radio. The good news is the show will be in excellent hands after Mat’s departure. We can finally announce Planetary Radio’s new host is Sarah Al-Ahmed.

title: Freelance Audio Editor (Contract)
summary: The Planetary Society, the world’s largest and most influential space advocacy organization, seeks a talented Audio Editor to support the post-production needs of our two podcasts.

title: Your guide to water on Mars
summary: Mars used to have oceans, lakes, and rivers. Where did the water go, how much is left, and how can we use it for science and exploration?

title: Europe in Space - Who should take responsibility for Ariane 6 delay?
summary: A weekly European spaceflight update with exclusive infographics, in-depth analysis, and a review of the week's biggest announcements.

title: New wonders to behold
summary: New stars are being born, new missions are being conceived, and new discoveries are being made all the time.

title: The live space feeds you should be following right now
summary: Here are some livestreams to save so you can watch rocket launch feeds, space station broadcasts off-Earth, and other space-related activities in real-time.
